channel.title: Forum Downtime
channel.description: Alot of people say its because someone is being banned so if thats the case why don't the admins tot up a list and then wait till sunday at around midnight forum time and do the bans then that way its less annoying for us lot. Maybe i'm being stupid( i'm guessing someone is gonna quote that and say 'yes you are') but it would be nicer

item.title: Forum Downtime
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:30, topic:209936”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=276434.msg2258679#msg2258679 date=1212464293]
Go straight to phpmyadmin and insert like a hundred rows of banned names.
Then make a file and make it check for banned names - it then renames the users account to ‘banned’ password ‘banned’ email ‘banned’ ip ‘banned’.

[quote=updatebans.php]<?php
$con = mysql_connect(“HOST”,“USER”,“PASS”);
if (!$con)
{
die('Could not connect: ’ . mysql_error());
}

mysql_select_db(“DATABASE”, $con);
$result = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM users WHERE banned=‘1’”);

while($row = mysql_fetch_array($result))
{
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET username = ‘banned’”);
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET password = ‘banned’”);
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET email = ‘banned’”);
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET ip = ‘banned’”);
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET ip1 = ‘banned’”);
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET ip2 = ‘banned’”);
}

mysql_close($con);
?>
[/quote]

You may need to change some things, I havent modded smf in a while.
[/quote]
LOLOLOLOL that was the most moparscapian thing I’ve ever seen!!![/quote]
Yet the chances are that it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Downtime
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:28, topic:209936”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=276434.msg2266211#msg2266211 date=1212999310]
I have tried a few things to fix it before but nothing has lasted very long, shortly though I WILL fix it no matter what I have to do, whether it be upgrading to 2.0, switching to another forum software or writing my own banning system. It’s really annoying and I’ll take care of it.
[/quote]
Isn’t it rather the database that requires the huge amount of time to insert the ban in the already huge table?[/quote]

Apparently not, seeing as how that one user prune supposedly didn’t work.

It might just be the fact that SMF’s retroactive ban system has to look at every member’s IP address and compare them to the 8+ fields to check to see if they should be denied access to the site, that’s like 225111 Members * 8 IP fields in ban list = 1800888+ comparisons, if those are all queries to the database, that might be a bit of a problem.

Or then again, I might have no clue what I’m talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Downtime
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:26, topic:209936”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=276434.msg2266211#msg2266211 date=1212999310]
I have tried a few things to fix it before but nothing has lasted very long, shortly though I WILL fix it no matter what I have to do, whether it be upgrading to 2.0, switching to another forum software or writing my own banning system. It’s really annoying and I’ll take care of it.
[/quote]
Sounds good. What I don’t understand is why the ban table has been designed in such a manner. IPB simply stores the whole IP address, wildcards included, as a single string.
I’m sure that’s far better for the database when comparing it to SMF’s 8 rows - 4 tinyint(3) for the IP addresses low bytes, and 4 for the high bytes (ie, low being 0, high being up to 255). And those 8 rows are for IP addresses alone; don’t forget about rows for hostname, email address, ban type, ban length, and anything else I may have missed.[/quote]
Because SMF sucks, thus you shouldn’t bother to understand who thought of its design and why. Its template system and its internal structures are as bad as phpmybb. Wait, actually phpmybb 3 has a better template system than SMF.

Read full topic

Sounds good. What I don’t understand is why the ban table has been designed in such a manner. IPB simply stores the whole IP address, wildcards included, as a single string.
I’m sure that’s far better for the database when comparing it to SMF’s 8 rows - 4 tinyint(3) for the IP addresses low bytes, and 4 for the high bytes (ie, low being 0, high being up to 255). And those 8 rows are for IP addresses alone; don’t forget about rows for hostname, email address, ban type, ban length, and anything else I may have missed.

item.title: Forum Downtime
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

quest rs:

Well im not sure if it helps but deleting everything and reinstalling it all. This place can use a total domination clean up haha. Or just deleting everything and reinstalling it and using the mysql backups to replace all the data. I fixed so many errors on my forums like that.

I doubt that’s possible, with all of the crappy manual code modifications we’ve got going here, it’d take forever to reunite the MSCP/MITB databases…

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Downtime

item.description:

Well im not sure if it helps but deleting everything and reinstalling it all. This place can use a total domination clean up haha. Or just deleting everything and reinstalling it and using the mysql backups to replace all the data. I fixed so many errors on my forums like that.

And PK I highly doubt the number has much to do with this, probably a couple of errors while adding mods is more like it, if not than perhaps a mysql database corruption?

Go straight to phpmyadmin and insert like a hundred rows of banned names.

<?php $con = mysql_connect("HOST","USER","PASS"); if (!$con) { die('Could not connect: ' . mysql_error()); }

$result = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM users WHERE banned=‘1’”);

mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET email = ‘banned’”);
mysql_query(“UPDATE users SET ip = ‘banned’”);
